intro: Verbesina sordescens var. sordescens, commonly known as the brownstem beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and stream banks. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers in the summer. Its stems are hairy and often have a reddish or brownish tinge, which gives it its common name. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads and medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
